poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Slight list to port. Two shots of fino Slide down the bar. She heeds her instinct, takes His glass. Here's to you. Fresh air? Up on deck He's blacking out. She bends to adjust her sling-backs heaves him up from the shins And over the rail. Who hears a splash? And that gouge on her wrist, wake on an oily reach â€“ The vessel heals.
